description: Ctrl-Alt-Speech is a weekly podcast about the latest news in online speech, from Mike Masnick and Everything in Moderation‘s Ben Whitelaw. title: Ctrl-Alt-Speech: Conspiracies Abhor A Vacuum

description: Apparently, exceptions apply. The “Thin Blue Line” is the supposedly united front of law enforcement that protects society against evil. But it’s not unconditional. If you’re a good cop, you get frozen out. And, if you’re a woman, you get treated like most cops treat most women. The “Blue Line” often seems to be the […]
title: What Thin Blue Line? Former Officer Paid $1 Million After Cops Shared Her Private Photos With Other Cops

description: I’m curious how Republicans would react if AOC suddenly sought to hold a hearing questioning Elon Musk’s bias in endorsing and promoting Donald Trump on ExTwitter. I imagine there would be apocalyptic outrage and nonstop cries of tyranny over such a blatant abuse of power to punish someone for their political views. And they’d be […]
title: When Will Jim Jordan Hold A Hearing About Elon’s ExTwitter Bias?

description: This is not great news, even if the law pretty much aligns with case law. Nonetheless, this is concerning. In 2021, the Tennessee General Assembly approved a […]
title: New Tennessee Law Says Law Enforcement Doesn’t Need Warrants To Fly Drones Over Private Property

description: We’ve noted a few times that states will soon receive more than $42.5 billion in taxpayer funded broadband subsidies courtesy of the 2021 infrastructure bill. title: GOP ‘Investigates’ NTIA For Wanting To Make Broadband Affordable To Poor People

description: Terms of Service are a reality we deal with all the time with digital goods and services. And by “deal with”, I mostly mean we don’t read them and simply agree to whatever they say instead, assuming there is nothing crazy in them. But that also causes a lot of problems, with customers of these […]
title: Sample Library Company Copyright Strikes YouTuber Over Showing Their ToS
